summary: This is a November 2024 memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) providing a status update on the BOP's implementation of recommendations from the OIG's June 2023 final report on the custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It details the BOP's responses and the OIG's analysis for eight recommendations aimed at improving suicide prevention, inmate monitoring, staffing, and security camera protocols.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose custody, care, and supervision at the Metropolitan Correctional Center was the subject of the original OIG investigation and report that prompted these recommendations.

events.title: OIG Final Report Release
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General issued its final report on the investigation and review of the Federal Bureau of Prisons' custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Automated Staffing Tool Implementation
events.description: The BOP's Automated Staffing Tool (AST) went live for all BOP professions, a key action in response to Recommendation 6 on addressing staffing shortages.

events.title: Security Camera Monthly Report Effective
events.description: The BOP's new monthly Security Camera Report, requiring facilities to document camera functionality and repairs, became effective.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, New York
keyFacts: The OIG's June 2023 report on Jeffrey Epstein's custody made 8 recommendations to the BOP; one (Recommendation 7) was previously closed.
As of November 2024, the BOP's responses have led the OIG to classify the remaining seven recommendations as 'Resolved,' but not yet closed, pending final policy implementation and review.
Key BOP actions include revising multiple Program Statements (e.g., on suicide prevention, unit management, correctional services) and implementing a new monthly security camera reporting system.
The BOP reported implementing an Automated Staffing Tool in October 2024 and is analyzing recruitment/retention incentives and pursuing special salary rates to address staffing shortages.
The document is a procedural update focused on policy reforms within the BOP, triggered by the failures that led to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
